title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 MIDCH: QUALITY HEALTHCARE, NUTRITION, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: 2.1 By 2022, the Health and Nutrition service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and nutrition interventions for girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, which contributes to Child Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, benefit from healthy, nurturing, protective environments and live free from violence.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL WATER SUPPLY AND DRAINAGE BOARD
STATE MINISTRY OF RURAL AND DIVISIO DRINKING WATER SUPPLY PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.1 By 2022, the Health and Nutrition service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, WASH and nutrition interventions for girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived

description.narrative: The national survey of the Community Managed Rural Water Supply Schemes, including climate resilience and governance aspects, was completed. The survey findings will be used by the public and decisions makers to inform the development of climate-resilient water supply system models that promote water safety and security. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: Availability of baseline information on safely managed water supply (SDG indicator 6.1) at household level

baseline.value: Score 1: No baseline data available on safely managed water supply at household level (SDG indicator 6.1)

target.value: 2020:Score 2: Survey on water supply SDG indicator 6.1 designed and conducted, as part of the overall HIES, to collect water quality baseline data in Sri Lanka. SDG indicator 6.1 has been integrated into the HIES for the future.

actual.value: 2019:Two JMP missions have been completed, training on SDG monitoring and training and pretesting of the Household Water Quality Survey were completed.

title.narrative: Availability of tested models on climate-resilient water supply systems that promote water safety and security

target.value: 2020:Score 3:Models developed and piloted on climate-resilient water supply systems that promote water safety and security. Capacity building of officals from the rural water supply sector on integrating climate resilience into water supply systems

actual.value: 2019:Baseline on community water schemes including climate change and governance elements was initiated.

title.narrative: Availability of a school health and nutrition policy

actual.value: 2019:Final draft of the School Health and Nutrition Policy submitted to the Ministry of Education and Health
